<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>
<s> the local population earns income from fishing raising livestock and sales of handicrafts <\s>
<s> because there are few jobs 25 of the work force has left to seek employment on ascension island on the falklands and in the uk <\s>
<s> saint kitts and nevis the economy of saint kitts and nevis is heavily dependent upon tourism revenues which has replaced sugar the traditional mainstay of the economy until the 1970s <\s>
<s> following the 2005 harvest the government closed the sugar industry after decades of losses of 3-4 of gdp annually <\s>
<s> to compensate for employment losses the government has embarked on a program to diversify the agricultural sector and to stimulate other sectors of the economy such as tourism export-oriented manufacturing and offshore banking <\s>
<s> more than 200,000 tourists visited the islands in 2009 <\s>
<s> like other tourist destinations in the caribbean st <\s>
<s> kitts and nevis is vulnerable to damage from natural disasters and shifts in tourism demand <\s>
<s> the current government is constrained by one of the world's highest public debt burdens equivalent to roughly 185 of gdp largely attributable to public enterprise losses <\s>
<s> saint lucia the island nation has been able to attract foreign business and investment especially in its offshore banking and tourism industries with a surge in foreign direct investment in 2006 attributed to the construction of several tourism projects <\s>
<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area and the government is trying to revitalize the banana industry although recent hurricanes have caused exports to contract <\s>
<s> saint lucia is vulnerable to a variety of external shocks including volatile tourism receipts natural disasters and dependence on foreign oil <\s>
<s> the public debt-to-gdp ratio is about 77 and high debt servicing obligations constrain the king administration's ability to respond to adverse external shocks <\s>
<s> economic fundamentals remain solid even though unemployment needs to be reduced <\s>
<s> saint martin the economy of saint martin centers around tourism with 85 of the labor force engaged in this sector <\s>
<s> over one million visitors come to the island each year with most arriving through the princess juliana international airport in sint maarten <\s>
<s> no significant agriculture and limited local fishing means that almost all food must be imported <\s>
<s> energy resources and manufactured goods are also imported primarily from mexico and the united states <\s>
<s> saint martin is reported to have the highest per capita income in the caribbean <\s>
<s> saint pierre and miquelon the inhabitants have traditionally earned their livelihood by fishing and by servicing fishing fleets operating off the coast of newfoundland <\s>
<s> the economy has been declining however because of disputes with canada over fishing quotas and a steady decline in the number of ships stopping at saint pierre <\s>
<s> in 1992 an arbitration panel awarded the islands an exclusive economic zone of 12,348 sq km to settle a longstanding territorial dispute with canada although it represents only 25 of what france had sought <\s>
<s> france heavily subsidizes the islands to the great betterment of living standards <\s>
<s> the government hopes an expansion of tourism will boost economic prospects <\s>
<s> fish farming crab fishing and agriculture are being developed to diversify the local economy <\s>
<s> recent test drilling for oil may pave the way for development of the energy sector <\s>
<s> saint vincent and the grenadines success of the economy hinges upon seasonal variations in agriculture tourism and construction activity as well as remittance inflows <\s>
<s> much of the workforce is employed in banana production and tourism but persistent high unemployment has prompted many to leave the islands <\s>
<s> this lower-middle-income country is vulnerable to natural disasters tropical storms wiped out substantial portions of crops in 1994 1995 and 2002 <\s>
<s> in 2008 the islands had more than 200,000 tourist arrivals mostly to the grenadines a drop of nearly 20 from 2007 <\s>
<s> saint vincent is home to a small offshore banking sector and has moved to adopt international regulatory standards <\s>
<s> the government's ability to invest in social programs and respond to external shocks is constrained by its high public debt burden which was over 90 of gdp at the end of 2010 <\s>
<s> following the global downturn st <\s>
<s> vincent and the grenadines saw an economic decline in 2009 after slowing since 2006 when gdp growth reached a 10 year high of nearly 7 <\s>
<s> the gonsalves administration is directing government resources to infrastructure projects including a new international airport that is expected to be completed in 2011 <\s>
<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>
<s> the country is vulnerable to devastating storms <\s>
<s> agriculture employs two-thirds of the labor force and furnishes 90 of exports featuring coconut cream coconut oil and copra <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector mainly processes agricultural products <\s>
<s> one factory in the foreign trade zone employs 3,000 people to make automobile electrical harnesses for an assembly plant in australia <\s>
<s> tourism is an expanding sector accounting for 25 of gdp 122,000 tourists visited the islands in 2007 <\s>
<s> in late september 2009 an earthquake and the resulting tsunami severely damaged samoa and nearby american samoa disrupting transportation and power generation and resulting in about 200 deaths <\s>
<s> the samoan government has called for deregulation of the financial sector encouragement of investment and continued fiscal discipline while at the same time protecting the environment <\s>
<s> observers point to the flexibility of the labor market as a basic strength for future economic advances <\s>
<s> foreign reserves are in a relatively healthy state the external debt is stable and inflation is low <\s>
<s> san marino san marino's economy relies heavily on its tourism and banking industries as well as on the manufacture and export of ceramics clothing fabrics furniture paints spirits tiles and wine <\s>
<s> the per capita level of output and standard of living are comparable to those of the most prosperous regions of italy which supplies much of its food <\s>
<s> san marino boasts the world's longest life expectancy for men with 80 years <\s>
<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>
<s> the country emerged in 2000 from a punishing three-year recession thanks to strong demand in eu export markets <\s>
<s> domestic consumption and investment have fueled strong gdp growth in recent years but have led to large current account imbalances <\s>
<s> romania's macroeconomic gains have only recently started to spur creation of a middle class and address romania's widespread poverty <\s>
<s> corruption and red tape continue to handicap its business environment <\s>
<s> inflation rose in 2007-08 driven in part by strong consumer demand and high wage growth rising energy costs a nation-wide drought affecting food prices and a relaxation of fiscal discipline <\s>
<s> romania's gdp contracted markedly in the last quarter of 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of a global downturn in financial markets and trade and gdp fell more than 7 in 2009 prompting bucharest to seek a 26 billion emergency assistance package from the imf the eu and other international lenders <\s>
<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
<s> the economy is expected to return to positive growth in 2011 <\s>
<s> russia russia has undergone significant changes since the collapse of the soviet union moving from a globally-isolated centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated economy <\s>
<s> economic reforms in the 1990s privatized most industry with notable exceptions in the energy and defense-related sectors <\s>
<s> the protection of property rights is still weak and the private sector remains subject to heavy state interference <\s>
<s> russian industry is primarily split between globally-competitive commodity producers in 2009 russia was the world's largest exporter of natural gas the second largest exporter of oil and the third largest exporter of steel and primary aluminum and other less competitive heavy industries that remain dependent on the russian domestic market <\s>
<s> this reliance on commodity exports makes russia vulnerable to boom and bust cycles that follow the highly volatile swings in global commodity prices <\s>
<s> the government since 2007 has embarked on an ambitious program to reduce this dependency and build up the country's high technology sectors but with few results so far <\s>
<s> the economy had averaged 7 growth since the 1998 russian financial crisis resulting in a doubling of real disposable incomes and the emergence of a middle class <\s>
<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>
<s> gdp has rebounded and inflation has been curbed <\s>
<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>
<s> despite rwanda's fertile ecosystem food production often does not keep pace with demand requiring food imports <\s>
<s> rwanda continues to receive substantial aid money and obtained imf-world bank heavily indebted poor country hipc initiative debt relief in 2005-06 <\s>
<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>
<s> africa's most densely populated country is trying to overcome the limitations of its small landlocked economy by leveraging regional trade <\s>
<s> rwanda joined the east african community and is aligning its budget trade and immigration policies with its regional partners <\s>
<s> the government has embraced an expansionary fiscal policy to reduce poverty by improving education infrastructure and foreign and domestic investment and pursuing market-oriented reforms although energy shortages instability in neighboring states and lack of adequate transportation linkages to other countries continue to handicap growth <\s>
<s> the global downturn hurt export demand and tourism but economic growth is recovering driven in large part by the services sector and inflation has been contained <\s>
<s> on the back of this growth government is gradually ending its fiscal stimulus policy while protecting aid to the poor <\s>
<s> saint barthelemy the economy of saint barthelemy is based upon high-end tourism and duty-free luxury commerce serving visitors primarily from north america <\s>
<s> the luxury hotels and villas host 70,000 visitors each year with another 130,000 arriving by boat <\s>
<s> the relative isolation and high cost of living inhibits mass tourism <\s>
<s> the construction and public sectors also enjoy significant investment in support of tourism <\s>
<s> with limited fresh water resources all food must be imported as must all energy resources and most manufactured goods <\s>
<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>

<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>
<s> the country is vulnerable to devastating storms <\s>
<s> agriculture employs two-thirds of the labor force and furnishes 90 of exports featuring coconut cream coconut oil and copra <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector mainly processes agricultural products <\s>
<s> one factory in the foreign trade zone employs 3,000 people to make automobile electrical harnesses for an assembly plant in australia <\s>
<s> tourism is an expanding sector accounting for 25 of gdp 122,000 tourists visited the islands in 2007 <\s>
<s> in late september 2009 an earthquake and the resulting tsunami severely damaged samoa and nearby american samoa disrupting transportation and power generation and resulting in about 200 deaths <\s>
<s> the samoan government has called for deregulation of the financial sector encouragement of investment and continued fiscal discipline while at the same time protecting the environment <\s>
<s> observers point to the flexibility of the labor market as a basic strength for future economic advances <\s>
<s> foreign reserves are in a relatively healthy state the external debt is stable and inflation is low <\s>
<s> san marino san marino's economy relies heavily on its tourism and banking industries as well as on the manufacture and export of ceramics clothing fabrics furniture paints spirits tiles and wine <\s>
<s> the per capita level of output and standard of living are comparable to those of the most prosperous regions of italy which supplies much of its food <\s>
<s> san marino boasts the world's longest life expectancy for men with 80 years <\s>
<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>
<s> the country emerged in 2000 from a punishing three-year recession thanks to strong demand in eu export markets <\s>
<s> domestic consumption and investment have fueled strong gdp growth in recent years but have led to large current account imbalances <\s>
<s> romania's macroeconomic gains have only recently started to spur creation of a middle class and address romania's widespread poverty <\s>
<s> corruption and red tape continue to handicap its business environment <\s>
<s> inflation rose in 2007-08 driven in part by strong consumer demand and high wage growth rising energy costs a nation-wide drought affecting food prices and a relaxation of fiscal discipline <\s>
<s> romania's gdp contracted markedly in the last quarter of 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of a global downturn in financial markets and trade and gdp fell more than 7 in 2009 prompting bucharest to seek a 26 billion emergency assistance package from the imf the eu and other international lenders <\s>
<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
<s> the economy is expected to return to positive growth in 2011 <\s>
<s> russia russia has undergone significant changes since the collapse of the soviet union moving from a globally-isolated centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated economy <\s>
<s> economic reforms in the 1990s privatized most industry with notable exceptions in the energy and defense-related sectors <\s>
<s> the protection of property rights is still weak and the private sector remains subject to heavy state interference <\s>
<s> russian industry is primarily split between globally-competitive commodity producers in 2009 russia was the world's largest exporter of natural gas the second largest exporter of oil and the third largest exporter of steel and primary aluminum and other less competitive heavy industries that remain dependent on the russian domestic market <\s>
<s> this reliance on commodity exports makes russia vulnerable to boom and bust cycles that follow the highly volatile swings in global commodity prices <\s>
<s> the government since 2007 has embarked on an ambitious program to reduce this dependency and build up the country's high technology sectors but with few results so far <\s>
<s> the economy had averaged 7 growth since the 1998 russian financial crisis resulting in a doubling of real disposable incomes and the emergence of a middle class <\s>
<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>
<s> gdp has rebounded and inflation has been curbed <\s>
<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>
<s> despite rwanda's fertile ecosystem food production often does not keep pace with demand requiring food imports <\s>
<s> rwanda continues to receive substantial aid money and obtained imf-world bank heavily indebted poor country hipc initiative debt relief in 2005-06 <\s>
<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>
<s> africa's most densely populated country is trying to overcome the limitations of its small landlocked economy by leveraging regional trade <\s>
<s> rwanda joined the east african community and is aligning its budget trade and immigration policies with its regional partners <\s>
<s> the government has embraced an expansionary fiscal policy to reduce poverty by improving education infrastructure and foreign and domestic investment and pursuing market-oriented reforms although energy shortages instability in neighboring states and lack of adequate transportation linkages to other countries continue to handicap growth <\s>
<s> the global downturn hurt export demand and tourism but economic growth is recovering driven in large part by the services sector and inflation has been contained <\s>
<s> on the back of this growth government is gradually ending its fiscal stimulus policy while protecting aid to the poor <\s>
<s> saint barthelemy the economy of saint barthelemy is based upon high-end tourism and duty-free luxury commerce serving visitors primarily from north america <\s>
<s> the luxury hotels and villas host 70,000 visitors each year with another 130,000 arriving by boat <\s>
<s> the relative isolation and high cost of living inhibits mass tourism <\s>
<s> the construction and public sectors also enjoy significant investment in support of tourism <\s>
<s> with limited fresh water resources all food must be imported as must all energy resources and most manufactured goods <\s>
<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>
<s> the local population earns income from fishing raising livestock and sales of handicrafts <\s>
<s> because there are few jobs 25 of the work force has left to seek employment on ascension island on the falklands and in the uk <\s>
<s> saint kitts and nevis the economy of saint kitts and nevis is heavily dependent upon tourism revenues which has replaced sugar the traditional mainstay of the economy until the 1970s <\s>
<s> following the 2005 harvest the government closed the sugar industry after decades of losses of 3-4 of gdp annually <\s>
<s> to compensate for employment losses the government has embarked on a program to diversify the agricultural sector and to stimulate other sectors of the economy such as tourism export-oriented manufacturing and offshore banking <\s>
<s> more than 200,000 tourists visited the islands in 2009 <\s>
<s> like other tourist destinations in the caribbean st <\s>
<s> kitts and nevis is vulnerable to damage from natural disasters and shifts in tourism demand <\s>
<s> the current government is constrained by one of the world's highest public debt burdens equivalent to roughly 185 of gdp largely attributable to public enterprise losses <\s>
<s> saint lucia the island nation has been able to attract foreign business and investment especially in its offshore banking and tourism industries with a surge in foreign direct investment in 2006 attributed to the construction of several tourism projects <\s>
<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area and the government is trying to revitalize the banana industry although recent hurricanes have caused exports to contract <\s>
<s> saint lucia is vulnerable to a variety of external shocks including volatile tourism receipts natural disasters and dependence on foreign oil <\s>
<s> the public debt-to-gdp ratio is about 77 and high debt servicing obligations constrain the king administration's ability to respond to adverse external shocks <\s>
<s> economic fundamentals remain solid even though unemployment needs to be reduced <\s>
<s> saint martin the economy of saint martin centers around tourism with 85 of the labor force engaged in this sector <\s>
<s> over one million visitors come to the island each year with most arriving through the princess juliana international airport in sint maarten <\s>
<s> no significant agriculture and limited local fishing means that almost all food must be imported <\s>
<s> energy resources and manufactured goods are also imported primarily from mexico and the united states <\s>
<s> saint martin is reported to have the highest per capita income in the caribbean <\s>
<s> saint pierre and miquelon the inhabitants have traditionally earned their livelihood by fishing and by servicing fishing fleets operating off the coast of newfoundland <\s>
<s> the economy has been declining however because of disputes with canada over fishing quotas and a steady decline in the number of ships stopping at saint pierre <\s>
<s> in 1992 an arbitration panel awarded the islands an exclusive economic zone of 12,348 sq km to settle a longstanding territorial dispute with canada although it represents only 25 of what france had sought <\s>
<s> france heavily subsidizes the islands to the great betterment of living standards <\s>
<s> the government hopes an expansion of tourism will boost economic prospects <\s>
<s> fish farming crab fishing and agriculture are being developed to diversify the local economy <\s>
<s> recent test drilling for oil may pave the way for development of the energy sector <\s>
<s> saint vincent and the grenadines success of the economy hinges upon seasonal variations in agriculture tourism and construction activity as well as remittance inflows <\s>
<s> much of the workforce is employed in banana production and tourism but persistent high unemployment has prompted many to leave the islands <\s>
<s> this lower-middle-income country is vulnerable to natural disasters tropical storms wiped out substantial portions of crops in 1994 1995 and 2002 <\s>
<s> in 2008 the islands had more than 200,000 tourist arrivals mostly to the grenadines a drop of nearly 20 from 2007 <\s>
<s> saint vincent is home to a small offshore banking sector and has moved to adopt international regulatory standards <\s>
<s> the government's ability to invest in social programs and respond to external shocks is constrained by its high public debt burden which was over 90 of gdp at the end of 2010 <\s>
<s> following the global downturn st <\s>
<s> vincent and the grenadines saw an economic decline in 2009 after slowing since 2006 when gdp growth reached a 10 year high of nearly 7 <\s>
<s> the gonsalves administration is directing government resources to infrastructure projects including a new international airport that is expected to be completed in 2011 <\s>
<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>

<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>
<s> gdp has rebounded and inflation has been curbed <\s>
<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>
<s> despite rwanda's fertile ecosystem food production often does not keep pace with demand requiring food imports <\s>
<s> rwanda continues to receive substantial aid money and obtained imf-world bank heavily indebted poor country hipc initiative debt relief in 2005-06 <\s>
<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>
<s> africa's most densely populated country is trying to overcome the limitations of its small landlocked economy by leveraging regional trade <\s>
<s> rwanda joined the east african community and is aligning its budget trade and immigration policies with its regional partners <\s>
<s> the government has embraced an expansionary fiscal policy to reduce poverty by improving education infrastructure and foreign and domestic investment and pursuing market-oriented reforms although energy shortages instability in neighboring states and lack of adequate transportation linkages to other countries continue to handicap growth <\s>
<s> the global downturn hurt export demand and tourism but economic growth is recovering driven in large part by the services sector and inflation has been contained <\s>
<s> on the back of this growth government is gradually ending its fiscal stimulus policy while protecting aid to the poor <\s>
<s> saint barthelemy the economy of saint barthelemy is based upon high-end tourism and duty-free luxury commerce serving visitors primarily from north america <\s>
<s> the luxury hotels and villas host 70,000 visitors each year with another 130,000 arriving by boat <\s>
<s> the relative isolation and high cost of living inhibits mass tourism <\s>
<s> the construction and public sectors also enjoy significant investment in support of tourism <\s>
<s> with limited fresh water resources all food must be imported as must all energy resources and most manufactured goods <\s>
<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>
<s> the local population earns income from fishing raising livestock and sales of handicrafts <\s>
<s> because there are few jobs 25 of the work force has left to seek employment on ascension island on the falklands and in the uk <\s>
<s> saint kitts and nevis the economy of saint kitts and nevis is heavily dependent upon tourism revenues which has replaced sugar the traditional mainstay of the economy until the 1970s <\s>
<s> following the 2005 harvest the government closed the sugar industry after decades of losses of 3-4 of gdp annually <\s>
<s> to compensate for employment losses the government has embarked on a program to diversify the agricultural sector and to stimulate other sectors of the economy such as tourism export-oriented manufacturing and offshore banking <\s>
<s> more than 200,000 tourists visited the islands in 2009 <\s>
<s> like other tourist destinations in the caribbean st <\s>
<s> kitts and nevis is vulnerable to damage from natural disasters and shifts in tourism demand <\s>
<s> the current government is constrained by one of the world's highest public debt burdens equivalent to roughly 185 of gdp largely attributable to public enterprise losses <\s>
<s> saint lucia the island nation has been able to attract foreign business and investment especially in its offshore banking and tourism industries with a surge in foreign direct investment in 2006 attributed to the construction of several tourism projects <\s>
<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area and the government is trying to revitalize the banana industry although recent hurricanes have caused exports to contract <\s>
<s> saint lucia is vulnerable to a variety of external shocks including volatile tourism receipts natural disasters and dependence on foreign oil <\s>
<s> the public debt-to-gdp ratio is about 77 and high debt servicing obligations constrain the king administration's ability to respond to adverse external shocks <\s>
<s> economic fundamentals remain solid even though unemployment needs to be reduced <\s>
<s> saint martin the economy of saint martin centers around tourism with 85 of the labor force engaged in this sector <\s>
<s> over one million visitors come to the island each year with most arriving through the princess juliana international airport in sint maarten <\s>
<s> no significant agriculture and limited local fishing means that almost all food must be imported <\s>
<s> energy resources and manufactured goods are also imported primarily from mexico and the united states <\s>
<s> saint martin is reported to have the highest per capita income in the caribbean <\s>
<s> saint pierre and miquelon the inhabitants have traditionally earned their livelihood by fishing and by servicing fishing fleets operating off the coast of newfoundland <\s>
<s> the economy has been declining however because of disputes with canada over fishing quotas and a steady decline in the number of ships stopping at saint pierre <\s>
<s> in 1992 an arbitration panel awarded the islands an exclusive economic zone of 12,348 sq km to settle a longstanding territorial dispute with canada although it represents only 25 of what france had sought <\s>
<s> france heavily subsidizes the islands to the great betterment of living standards <\s>
<s> the government hopes an expansion of tourism will boost economic prospects <\s>
<s> fish farming crab fishing and agriculture are being developed to diversify the local economy <\s>
<s> recent test drilling for oil may pave the way for development of the energy sector <\s>
<s> saint vincent and the grenadines success of the economy hinges upon seasonal variations in agriculture tourism and construction activity as well as remittance inflows <\s>
<s> much of the workforce is employed in banana production and tourism but persistent high unemployment has prompted many to leave the islands <\s>
<s> this lower-middle-income country is vulnerable to natural disasters tropical storms wiped out substantial portions of crops in 1994 1995 and 2002 <\s>
<s> in 2008 the islands had more than 200,000 tourist arrivals mostly to the grenadines a drop of nearly 20 from 2007 <\s>
<s> saint vincent is home to a small offshore banking sector and has moved to adopt international regulatory standards <\s>
<s> the government's ability to invest in social programs and respond to external shocks is constrained by its high public debt burden which was over 90 of gdp at the end of 2010 <\s>
<s> following the global downturn st <\s>
<s> vincent and the grenadines saw an economic decline in 2009 after slowing since 2006 when gdp growth reached a 10 year high of nearly 7 <\s>
<s> the gonsalves administration is directing government resources to infrastructure projects including a new international airport that is expected to be completed in 2011 <\s>
<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>
<s> the country is vulnerable to devastating storms <\s>
<s> agriculture employs two-thirds of the labor force and furnishes 90 of exports featuring coconut cream coconut oil and copra <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector mainly processes agricultural products <\s>
<s> one factory in the foreign trade zone employs 3,000 people to make automobile electrical harnesses for an assembly plant in australia <\s>
<s> tourism is an expanding sector accounting for 25 of gdp 122,000 tourists visited the islands in 2007 <\s>
<s> in late september 2009 an earthquake and the resulting tsunami severely damaged samoa and nearby american samoa disrupting transportation and power generation and resulting in about 200 deaths <\s>
<s> the samoan government has called for deregulation of the financial sector encouragement of investment and continued fiscal discipline while at the same time protecting the environment <\s>
<s> observers point to the flexibility of the labor market as a basic strength for future economic advances <\s>
<s> foreign reserves are in a relatively healthy state the external debt is stable and inflation is low <\s>
<s> san marino san marino's economy relies heavily on its tourism and banking industries as well as on the manufacture and export of ceramics clothing fabrics furniture paints spirits tiles and wine <\s>
<s> the per capita level of output and standard of living are comparable to those of the most prosperous regions of italy which supplies much of its food <\s>
<s> san marino boasts the world's longest life expectancy for men with 80 years <\s>
<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>
<s> the country emerged in 2000 from a punishing three-year recession thanks to strong demand in eu export markets <\s>
<s> domestic consumption and investment have fueled strong gdp growth in recent years but have led to large current account imbalances <\s>
<s> romania's macroeconomic gains have only recently started to spur creation of a middle class and address romania's widespread poverty <\s>
<s> corruption and red tape continue to handicap its business environment <\s>
<s> inflation rose in 2007-08 driven in part by strong consumer demand and high wage growth rising energy costs a nation-wide drought affecting food prices and a relaxation of fiscal discipline <\s>
<s> romania's gdp contracted markedly in the last quarter of 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of a global downturn in financial markets and trade and gdp fell more than 7 in 2009 prompting bucharest to seek a 26 billion emergency assistance package from the imf the eu and other international lenders <\s>
<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
<s> the economy is expected to return to positive growth in 2011 <\s>
<s> russia russia has undergone significant changes since the collapse of the soviet union moving from a globally-isolated centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated economy <\s>
<s> economic reforms in the 1990s privatized most industry with notable exceptions in the energy and defense-related sectors <\s>
<s> the protection of property rights is still weak and the private sector remains subject to heavy state interference <\s>
<s> russian industry is primarily split between globally-competitive commodity producers in 2009 russia was the world's largest exporter of natural gas the second largest exporter of oil and the third largest exporter of steel and primary aluminum and other less competitive heavy industries that remain dependent on the russian domestic market <\s>
<s> this reliance on commodity exports makes russia vulnerable to boom and bust cycles that follow the highly volatile swings in global commodity prices <\s>
<s> the government since 2007 has embarked on an ambitious program to reduce this dependency and build up the country's high technology sectors but with few results so far <\s>
<s> the economy had averaged 7 growth since the 1998 russian financial crisis resulting in a doubling of real disposable incomes and the emergence of a middle class <\s>
<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>

<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>

<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>

<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area and the government is trying to revitalize the banana industry although recent hurricanes have caused exports to contract <\s>
<s> saint lucia is vulnerable to a variety of external shocks including volatile tourism receipts natural disasters and dependence on foreign oil <\s>
<s> the public debt-to-gdp ratio is about 77 and high debt servicing obligations constrain the king administration's ability to respond to adverse external shocks <\s>
<s> economic fundamentals remain solid even though unemployment needs to be reduced <\s>
<s> saint martin the economy of saint martin centers around tourism with 85 of the labor force engaged in this sector <\s>
<s> over one million visitors come to the island each year with most arriving through the princess juliana international airport in sint maarten <\s>
<s> no significant agriculture and limited local fishing means that almost all food must be imported <\s>
<s> energy resources and manufactured goods are also imported primarily from mexico and the united states <\s>
<s> saint martin is reported to have the highest per capita income in the caribbean <\s>
<s> saint pierre and miquelon the inhabitants have traditionally earned their livelihood by fishing and by servicing fishing fleets operating off the coast of newfoundland <\s>
<s> the economy has been declining however because of disputes with canada over fishing quotas and a steady decline in the number of ships stopping at saint pierre <\s>
<s> in 1992 an arbitration panel awarded the islands an exclusive economic zone of 12,348 sq km to settle a longstanding territorial dispute with canada although it represents only 25 of what france had sought <\s>
<s> france heavily subsidizes the islands to the great betterment of living standards <\s>
<s> the government hopes an expansion of tourism will boost economic prospects <\s>
<s> fish farming crab fishing and agriculture are being developed to diversify the local economy <\s>
<s> recent test drilling for oil may pave the way for development of the energy sector <\s>
<s> saint vincent and the grenadines success of the economy hinges upon seasonal variations in agriculture tourism and construction activity as well as remittance inflows <\s>
<s> much of the workforce is employed in banana production and tourism but persistent high unemployment has prompted many to leave the islands <\s>
<s> this lower-middle-income country is vulnerable to natural disasters tropical storms wiped out substantial portions of crops in 1994 1995 and 2002 <\s>
<s> in 2008 the islands had more than 200,000 tourist arrivals mostly to the grenadines a drop of nearly 20 from 2007 <\s>
<s> saint vincent is home to a small offshore banking sector and has moved to adopt international regulatory standards <\s>
<s> the government's ability to invest in social programs and respond to external shocks is constrained by its high public debt burden which was over 90 of gdp at the end of 2010 <\s>
<s> following the global downturn st <\s>
<s> vincent and the grenadines saw an economic decline in 2009 after slowing since 2006 when gdp growth reached a 10 year high of nearly 7 <\s>
<s> the gonsalves administration is directing government resources to infrastructure projects including a new international airport that is expected to be completed in 2011 <\s>
<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>
<s> the country is vulnerable to devastating storms <\s>
<s> agriculture employs two-thirds of the labor force and furnishes 90 of exports featuring coconut cream coconut oil and copra <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector mainly processes agricultural products <\s>
<s> one factory in the foreign trade zone employs 3,000 people to make automobile electrical harnesses for an assembly plant in australia <\s>
<s> tourism is an expanding sector accounting for 25 of gdp 122,000 tourists visited the islands in 2007 <\s>
<s> in late september 2009 an earthquake and the resulting tsunami severely damaged samoa and nearby american samoa disrupting transportation and power generation and resulting in about 200 deaths <\s>
<s> the samoan government has called for deregulation of the financial sector encouragement of investment and continued fiscal discipline while at the same time protecting the environment <\s>
<s> observers point to the flexibility of the labor market as a basic strength for future economic advances <\s>
<s> foreign reserves are in a relatively healthy state the external debt is stable and inflation is low <\s>
<s> san marino san marino's economy relies heavily on its tourism and banking industries as well as on the manufacture and export of ceramics clothing fabrics furniture paints spirits tiles and wine <\s>
<s> the per capita level of output and standard of living are comparable to those of the most prosperous regions of italy which supplies much of its food <\s>
<s> san marino boasts the world's longest life expectancy for men with 80 years <\s>
<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>
<s> the country emerged in 2000 from a punishing three-year recession thanks to strong demand in eu export markets <\s>
<s> domestic consumption and investment have fueled strong gdp growth in recent years but have led to large current account imbalances <\s>
<s> romania's macroeconomic gains have only recently started to spur creation of a middle class and address romania's widespread poverty <\s>
<s> corruption and red tape continue to handicap its business environment <\s>
<s> inflation rose in 2007-08 driven in part by strong consumer demand and high wage growth rising energy costs a nation-wide drought affecting food prices and a relaxation of fiscal discipline <\s>
<s> romania's gdp contracted markedly in the last quarter of 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of a global downturn in financial markets and trade and gdp fell more than 7 in 2009 prompting bucharest to seek a 26 billion emergency assistance package from the imf the eu and other international lenders <\s>
<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
<s> the economy is expected to return to positive growth in 2011 <\s>
<s> russia russia has undergone significant changes since the collapse of the soviet union moving from a globally-isolated centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated economy <\s>
<s> economic reforms in the 1990s privatized most industry with notable exceptions in the energy and defense-related sectors <\s>
<s> the protection of property rights is still weak and the private sector remains subject to heavy state interference <\s>
<s> russian industry is primarily split between globally-competitive commodity producers in 2009 russia was the world's largest exporter of natural gas the second largest exporter of oil and the third largest exporter of steel and primary aluminum and other less competitive heavy industries that remain dependent on the russian domestic market <\s>
<s> this reliance on commodity exports makes russia vulnerable to boom and bust cycles that follow the highly volatile swings in global commodity prices <\s>
<s> the government since 2007 has embarked on an ambitious program to reduce this dependency and build up the country's high technology sectors but with few results so far <\s>
<s> the economy had averaged 7 growth since the 1998 russian financial crisis resulting in a doubling of real disposable incomes and the emergence of a middle class <\s>
<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>
<s> gdp has rebounded and inflation has been curbed <\s>
<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>
<s> despite rwanda's fertile ecosystem food production often does not keep pace with demand requiring food imports <\s>
<s> rwanda continues to receive substantial aid money and obtained imf-world bank heavily indebted poor country hipc initiative debt relief in 2005-06 <\s>
<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>
<s> africa's most densely populated country is trying to overcome the limitations of its small landlocked economy by leveraging regional trade <\s>
<s> rwanda joined the east african community and is aligning its budget trade and immigration policies with its regional partners <\s>
<s> the government has embraced an expansionary fiscal policy to reduce poverty by improving education infrastructure and foreign and domestic investment and pursuing market-oriented reforms although energy shortages instability in neighboring states and lack of adequate transportation linkages to other countries continue to handicap growth <\s>
<s> the global downturn hurt export demand and tourism but economic growth is recovering driven in large part by the services sector and inflation has been contained <\s>
<s> on the back of this growth government is gradually ending its fiscal stimulus policy while protecting aid to the poor <\s>
<s> saint barthelemy the economy of saint barthelemy is based upon high-end tourism and duty-free luxury commerce serving visitors primarily from north america <\s>
<s> the luxury hotels and villas host 70,000 visitors each year with another 130,000 arriving by boat <\s>
<s> the relative isolation and high cost of living inhibits mass tourism <\s>
<s> the construction and public sectors also enjoy significant investment in support of tourism <\s>
<s> with limited fresh water resources all food must be imported as must all energy resources and most manufactured goods <\s>
<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>
<s> the local population earns income from fishing raising livestock and sales of handicrafts <\s>
<s> because there are few jobs 25 of the work force has left to seek employment on ascension island on the falklands and in the uk <\s>
<s> saint kitts and nevis the economy of saint kitts and nevis is heavily dependent upon tourism revenues which has replaced sugar the traditional mainstay of the economy until the 1970s <\s>
<s> following the 2005 harvest the government closed the sugar industry after decades of losses of 3-4 of gdp annually <\s>
<s> to compensate for employment losses the government has embarked on a program to diversify the agricultural sector and to stimulate other sectors of the economy such as tourism export-oriented manufacturing and offshore banking <\s>
<s> more than 200,000 tourists visited the islands in 2009 <\s>
<s> like other tourist destinations in the caribbean st <\s>
<s> kitts and nevis is vulnerable to damage from natural disasters and shifts in tourism demand <\s>
<s> the current government is constrained by one of the world's highest public debt burdens equivalent to roughly 185 of gdp largely attributable to public enterprise losses <\s>
<s> saint lucia the island nation has been able to attract foreign business and investment especially in its offshore banking and tourism industries with a surge in foreign direct investment in 2006 attributed to the construction of several tourism projects <\s>
<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>

<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>
<s> the country emerged in 2000 from a punishing three-year recession thanks to strong demand in eu export markets <\s>
<s> domestic consumption and investment have fueled strong gdp growth in recent years but have led to large current account imbalances <\s>
<s> romania's macroeconomic gains have only recently started to spur creation of a middle class and address romania's widespread poverty <\s>
<s> corruption and red tape continue to handicap its business environment <\s>
<s> inflation rose in 2007-08 driven in part by strong consumer demand and high wage growth rising energy costs a nation-wide drought affecting food prices and a relaxation of fiscal discipline <\s>
<s> romania's gdp contracted markedly in the last quarter of 2008 as the country began to feel the effects of a global downturn in financial markets and trade and gdp fell more than 7 in 2009 prompting bucharest to seek a 26 billion emergency assistance package from the imf the eu and other international lenders <\s>
<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
<s> the economy is expected to return to positive growth in 2011 <\s>
<s> russia russia has undergone significant changes since the collapse of the soviet union moving from a globally-isolated centrally-planned economy to a more market-based and globally-integrated economy <\s>
<s> economic reforms in the 1990s privatized most industry with notable exceptions in the energy and defense-related sectors <\s>
<s> the protection of property rights is still weak and the private sector remains subject to heavy state interference <\s>
<s> russian industry is primarily split between globally-competitive commodity producers in 2009 russia was the world's largest exporter of natural gas the second largest exporter of oil and the third largest exporter of steel and primary aluminum and other less competitive heavy industries that remain dependent on the russian domestic market <\s>
<s> this reliance on commodity exports makes russia vulnerable to boom and bust cycles that follow the highly volatile swings in global commodity prices <\s>
<s> the government since 2007 has embarked on an ambitious program to reduce this dependency and build up the country's high technology sectors but with few results so far <\s>
<s> the economy had averaged 7 growth since the 1998 russian financial crisis resulting in a doubling of real disposable incomes and the emergence of a middle class <\s>
<s> the russian economy however was one of the hardest hit by the 2008-09 global economic crisis as oil prices plummeted and the foreign credits that russian banks and firms relied on dried up <\s>
<s> the central bank of russia spent one-third of its 600 billion international reserves the world's third largest in late 2008 to slow the devaluation of the ruble <\s>
<s> the government also devoted 200 billion in a rescue plan to increase liquidity in the banking sector and aid russian firms unable to roll over large foreign debts coming due <\s>
<s> the economic decline bottomed out in mid 2009 and the economy began to grow in the first quarter of 2010 <\s>
<s> however a severe drought and fires in central russia reduced agricultural output prompting a ban on grain exports for part of the year and slowed growth in other sectors such as manufacturing and retail trade <\s>
<s> russia's long-term challenges include a shrinking workforce a high level of corruption difficulty in accessing capital for smaller non-energy companies and poor infrastructure in need of large investments <\s>
<s> rwanda rwanda is a poor rural country with about 90 of the population engaged in mainly subsistence agriculture and some mineral and agro-processing <\s>
<s> in 2008 minerals overtook coffee and tea as rwanda's primary foreign exchange earner <\s>
<s> the 1994 genocide decimated rwanda's fragile economic base severely impoverished the population particularly women and temporarily stalled the country's ability to attract private and external investment <\s>
<s> however rwanda has made substantial progress in stabilizing and rehabilitating its economy to pre 1994 levels <\s>
<s> gdp has rebounded and inflation has been curbed <\s>
<s> nonetheless a majority still live below the poverty line of 250 rwandan francs per day about us 0.43 <\s>
<s> despite rwanda's fertile ecosystem food production often does not keep pace with demand requiring food imports <\s>
<s> rwanda continues to receive substantial aid money and obtained imf-world bank heavily indebted poor country hipc initiative debt relief in 2005-06 <\s>
<s> rwanda also received a millennium challenge account compact in 2008 <\s>
<s> africa's most densely populated country is trying to overcome the limitations of its small landlocked economy by leveraging regional trade <\s>
<s> rwanda joined the east african community and is aligning its budget trade and immigration policies with its regional partners <\s>
<s> the government has embraced an expansionary fiscal policy to reduce poverty by improving education infrastructure and foreign and domestic investment and pursuing market-oriented reforms although energy shortages instability in neighboring states and lack of adequate transportation linkages to other countries continue to handicap growth <\s>
<s> the global downturn hurt export demand and tourism but economic growth is recovering driven in large part by the services sector and inflation has been contained <\s>
<s> on the back of this growth government is gradually ending its fiscal stimulus policy while protecting aid to the poor <\s>
<s> saint barthelemy the economy of saint barthelemy is based upon high-end tourism and duty-free luxury commerce serving visitors primarily from north america <\s>
<s> the luxury hotels and villas host 70,000 visitors each year with another 130,000 arriving by boat <\s>
<s> the relative isolation and high cost of living inhibits mass tourism <\s>
<s> the construction and public sectors also enjoy significant investment in support of tourism <\s>
<s> with limited fresh water resources all food must be imported as must all energy resources and most manufactured goods <\s>
<s> employment is strong and attracts labor from brazil and portugal <\s>
<s> saint helena ascension and tristan da cunha the economy depends largely on financial assistance from the uk which amounted to about 27 million in fy06 07 or more than twice the level of annual budgetary revenues <\s>
<s> the local population earns income from fishing raising livestock and sales of handicrafts <\s>
<s> because there are few jobs 25 of the work force has left to seek employment on ascension island on the falklands and in the uk <\s>
<s> saint kitts and nevis the economy of saint kitts and nevis is heavily dependent upon tourism revenues which has replaced sugar the traditional mainstay of the economy until the 1970s <\s>
<s> following the 2005 harvest the government closed the sugar industry after decades of losses of 3-4 of gdp annually <\s>
<s> to compensate for employment losses the government has embarked on a program to diversify the agricultural sector and to stimulate other sectors of the economy such as tourism export-oriented manufacturing and offshore banking <\s>
<s> more than 200,000 tourists visited the islands in 2009 <\s>
<s> like other tourist destinations in the caribbean st <\s>
<s> kitts and nevis is vulnerable to damage from natural disasters and shifts in tourism demand <\s>
<s> the current government is constrained by one of the world's highest public debt burdens equivalent to roughly 185 of gdp largely attributable to public enterprise losses <\s>
<s> saint lucia the island nation has been able to attract foreign business and investment especially in its offshore banking and tourism industries with a surge in foreign direct investment in 2006 attributed to the construction of several tourism projects <\s>
<s> although crops such as bananas mangos and avocados continue to be grown for export tourism provides saint lucia's main source of income and the industry is the island's biggest employer <\s>
<s> tourism is the main source of foreign exchange although tourism sector revenues declined with the global economic downturn as us and european travel dropped in 2009 <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector is the most diverse in the eastern caribbean area and the government is trying to revitalize the banana industry although recent hurricanes have caused exports to contract <\s>
<s> saint lucia is vulnerable to a variety of external shocks including volatile tourism receipts natural disasters and dependence on foreign oil <\s>
<s> the public debt-to-gdp ratio is about 77 and high debt servicing obligations constrain the king administration's ability to respond to adverse external shocks <\s>
<s> economic fundamentals remain solid even though unemployment needs to be reduced <\s>
<s> saint martin the economy of saint martin centers around tourism with 85 of the labor force engaged in this sector <\s>
<s> over one million visitors come to the island each year with most arriving through the princess juliana international airport in sint maarten <\s>
<s> no significant agriculture and limited local fishing means that almost all food must be imported <\s>
<s> energy resources and manufactured goods are also imported primarily from mexico and the united states <\s>
<s> saint martin is reported to have the highest per capita income in the caribbean <\s>
<s> saint pierre and miquelon the inhabitants have traditionally earned their livelihood by fishing and by servicing fishing fleets operating off the coast of newfoundland <\s>
<s> the economy has been declining however because of disputes with canada over fishing quotas and a steady decline in the number of ships stopping at saint pierre <\s>
<s> in 1992 an arbitration panel awarded the islands an exclusive economic zone of 12,348 sq km to settle a longstanding territorial dispute with canada although it represents only 25 of what france had sought <\s>
<s> france heavily subsidizes the islands to the great betterment of living standards <\s>
<s> the government hopes an expansion of tourism will boost economic prospects <\s>
<s> fish farming crab fishing and agriculture are being developed to diversify the local economy <\s>
<s> recent test drilling for oil may pave the way for development of the energy sector <\s>
<s> saint vincent and the grenadines success of the economy hinges upon seasonal variations in agriculture tourism and construction activity as well as remittance inflows <\s>
<s> much of the workforce is employed in banana production and tourism but persistent high unemployment has prompted many to leave the islands <\s>
<s> this lower-middle-income country is vulnerable to natural disasters tropical storms wiped out substantial portions of crops in 1994 1995 and 2002 <\s>
<s> in 2008 the islands had more than 200,000 tourist arrivals mostly to the grenadines a drop of nearly 20 from 2007 <\s>
<s> saint vincent is home to a small offshore banking sector and has moved to adopt international regulatory standards <\s>
<s> the government's ability to invest in social programs and respond to external shocks is constrained by its high public debt burden which was over 90 of gdp at the end of 2010 <\s>
<s> following the global downturn st <\s>
<s> vincent and the grenadines saw an economic decline in 2009 after slowing since 2006 when gdp growth reached a 10 year high of nearly 7 <\s>
<s> the gonsalves administration is directing government resources to infrastructure projects including a new international airport that is expected to be completed in 2011 <\s>
<s> samoa the economy of samoa has traditionally been dependent on development aid family remittances from overseas agriculture and fishing <\s>
<s> the country is vulnerable to devastating storms <\s>
<s> agriculture employs two-thirds of the labor force and furnishes 90 of exports featuring coconut cream coconut oil and copra <\s>
<s> the manufacturing sector mainly processes agricultural products <\s>
<s> one factory in the foreign trade zone employs 3,000 people to make automobile electrical harnesses for an assembly plant in australia <\s>
<s> tourism is an expanding sector accounting for 25 of gdp 122,000 tourists visited the islands in 2007 <\s>
<s> in late september 2009 an earthquake and the resulting tsunami severely damaged samoa and nearby american samoa disrupting transportation and power generation and resulting in about 200 deaths <\s>
<s> the samoan government has called for deregulation of the financial sector encouragement of investment and continued fiscal discipline while at the same time protecting the environment <\s>
<s> observers point to the flexibility of the labor market as a basic strength for future economic advances <\s>
<s> foreign reserves are in a relatively healthy state the external debt is stable and inflation is low <\s>
<s> san marino san marino's economy relies heavily on its tourism and banking industries as well as on the manufacture and export of ceramics clothing fabrics furniture paints spirits tiles and wine <\s>
<s> the per capita level of output and standard of living are comparable to those of the most prosperous regions of italy which supplies much of its food <\s>
<s> san marino boasts the world's longest life expectancy for men with 80 years <\s>
<s> the economy benefits from foreign investment due to its relatively low corporate taxes and low taxes on interest earnings <\s>
<s> san marino has recently faced increased international pressure to improve cooperation with foreign tax authorities and transparency within its own banking sector which generates about one-fifth of the country's tax revenues <\s>
<s> italy's implementation in october 2009 of a tax amnesty to repatriate untaxed funds held abroad has resulted in financial outflows from san marino to italy worth more than 4.5 billion <\s>
<s> such outflows combined with a money-laundering scandal at san marino's largest financial institution and the recent global economic downturn have contributed to a deep recession and growing budget deficit <\s>
<s> however san marino has no national debt and an unemployment rate half the size of italy's <\s>
<s> the san marino government has adopted measures to counter the downturn including subsidized credit to businesses <\s>
<s> san marino also continues to work towards harmonizing its fiscal laws with eu members and international standards <\s>
<s> in september 2009 the oecd removed san marino from its list of tax havens that have yet to fully implement global tax standards <\s>

<s> drastic austerity measures as part of romania's imf-led agreement led to a further 1.9 gdp contraction in 2010 <\s>
